title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Text Interchange Format
text: package describes validates formats storing common object arising text analysis native R objects. Representations text corpus, document term matrix, tokenized text included. tokenized text format extensible include annotations. two versions corpus tokens objects; packages accept return coerce least one .

title: Text Interchange Format
text: can install development version using devtools:

title: Text Interchange Format
text: package can used check particular object valid format. example, see object corpus valid corpus data frame: package also functions convert list data frame formats corpus token object. example: Note extra meta data columns lost conversion data frame named character vector.
code: library(tif) corpus <- data.frame(doc_id = c("doc1", "doc2", "doc3"),                      text = c("Aujourd'hui, maman est morte.",                       "It was a pleasure to burn.",                       "All this happened, more or less."),                      stringsAsFactors = FALSE)  tif_is_corpus_df(corpus) TRUE tif_as_corpus_character(corpus) doc1                               doc2     "Aujourd'hui, maman est morte."       "It was a pleasure to burn."                                doc3  "All this happened, more or less."

title: Text Interchange Format
text: package describes validates formats storing common object arising text analysis native R objects. Representations text corpus, document term matrix, tokenized text included. tokenized text format extensible include annotations. two versions corpus tokens objects; packages accept return least one . corpus (data frame) - valid corpus data frame object data frame least two columns. first column called doc_id character vector UTF-8 encoding. Document ids must unique. second column called text must also character vector UTF-8 encoding. individual document represented single row data frame. Addition document-level metadata columns corpus level attributes allowed required. corpus (character vector) - valid character vector corpus object character vector UTF-8 encoding. names, unique character also UTF-8 encoding. attributes present. dtm - valid document term matrix sparse matrix row representing documents columns representing terms. row names character vector giving document ids duplicated entries. column names character vector giving terms matrix duplicated entries. sparse matrix inherit Matrix class dgCMatrix. tokens (data frame) - valid data frame tokens object data frame least two columns. must column called doc_id character vector UTF-8 encoding. Document ids must unique. must also column called token must also character vector UTF-8 encoding. individual token represented single row data frame. Addition token-level metadata columns allowed required. tokens (list) - valid corpus tokens object (possibly named) list character vectors. character vectors, well names, UTF-8 encoding. attributes present either list elements.

title: tif: Text Interchange Formats — tif-package
text: package describes validates formats storing common object arising text analysis native R objects. Representations text corpus, document term matrix, tokenized text included. corpus tokens objects multiple valid formats. Packages compliant tif proposal accept valid formats directly return, provide conversion functions, converting outputs least one formats (applicable). tokenized text format extensible include annotations part speech tags named entities.

what: Coerce Between tif Object Specifications — tif_as
title: Coerce Between tif Object Specifications — tif_as
text: functions convert various valid formats corpus tokens objects. using packages, maintainers need handle whichever specific format like work , gain freedom output (convert ) one suited package's paradigm.

title: Coerce Between tif Object Specifications — tif_as
code: tif_as_corpus_character(corpus)  # S3 method for default tif_as_corpus_character(corpus)  # S3 method for character tif_as_corpus_character(corpus)  # S3 method for data.frame tif_as_corpus_character(corpus)  tif_as_corpus_df(corpus)  # S3 method for default tif_as_corpus_df(corpus)  # S3 method for character tif_as_corpus_df(corpus)  # S3 method for data.frame tif_as_corpus_df(corpus)  tif_as_tokens_df(tokens)  # S3 method for default tif_as_tokens_df(tokens)  # S3 method for list tif_as_tokens_df(tokens)  # S3 method for data.frame tif_as_tokens_df(tokens)  tif_as_tokens_list(tokens)  # S3 method for default tif_as_tokens_list(tokens)  # S3 method for list tif_as_tokens_list(tokens)  # S3 method for data.frame tif_as_tokens_list(tokens)

title: Coerce Between tif Object Specifications — tif_as
text: corpus valid tif corpus object coerce tokens valid tif tokens object coerce

title: Coerce Between tif Object Specifications — tif_as
text: explicit checking done input; output guaranteed valid input valid format. fact, make effort modify object appears required format already due R's copy modify semantics.

title: Coerce Between tif Object Specifications — tif_as
code: # coerce corpus object corpus <- c("Aujourd'hui, maman est morte.",             "It was a pleasure to burn.",             "All this happened, more or less.") names(corpus) <- c("Camus", "Bradbury", "Vonnegut")  new <- tif_as_corpus_df(corpus) new #>     doc_id                             text #> 1    Camus    Aujourd'hui, maman est morte. #> 2 Bradbury       It was a pleasure to burn. #> 3 Vonnegut All this happened, more or less. tif_as_corpus_character(new) #>                              Camus                           Bradbury  #>    "Aujourd'hui, maman est morte."       "It was a pleasure to burn."  #>                           Vonnegut  #> "All this happened, more or less."   # coerce tokens object tokens <- list(doc1 = c("aujourd'hui", "maman", "est", "morte"),                doc2 = c("it", "was", "a", "pleasure", "to", "burn"),                doc3 = c("all", "this", "happened", "more", "or", "less"))  new <- tif_as_tokens_df(tokens) new #>    doc_id       token #> 1    doc1 aujourd'hui #> 2    doc1       maman #> 3    doc1         est #> 4    doc1       morte #> 5    doc2          it #> 6    doc2         was #> 7    doc2           a #> 8    doc2    pleasure #> 9    doc2          to #> 10   doc2        burn #> 11   doc3         all #> 12   doc3        this #> 13   doc3    happened #> 14   doc3        more #> 15   doc3          or #> 16   doc3        less tif_as_tokens_list(new) #> $doc1 #> [1] "aujourd'hui" "maman"       "est"         "morte"       #>  #> $doc2 #> [1] "it"       "was"      "a"        "pleasure" "to"       "burn"     #>  #> $doc3 #> [1] "all"      "this"     "happened" "more"     "or"       "less"     #>

what: Validate Corpus Data Frame Object — tif_is_corpus_df
title: Validate Corpus Data Frame Object — tif_is_corpus_df
text: valid data frame corpus object object least two columns. One column must called doc_id character vector UTF-8 encoding. Document ids must unique. must also column called text must also character vector UTF-8 encoding. individual document represented single row data frame. Addition document-level metadata columns corpus level attributes allowed required.

title: Validate Corpus Data Frame Object — tif_is_corpus_df
code: corpus <- data.frame(doc_id = c("doc1", "doc2", "doc3"),                      text = c("Aujourd'hui, maman est morte.",                       "It was a pleasure to burn.",                       "All this happened, more or less."),                      stringsAsFactors = FALSE)  tif_is_corpus_df(corpus) #> [1] TRUE  corpus$author <- c("Camus", "Bradbury", "Vonnegut") tif_is_corpus_df(corpus) #> [1] TRUE

code: #' @importFrom Matrix Matrix dtm <- Matrix::Matrix(0, ncol = 26, nrow = 5, sparse = TRUE) colnames(dtm) <- LETTERS rownames(dtm) <- sprintf("doc%d", 1:5)  tif_is_dtm(dtm) #> [1] TRUE

what: Validate Tokens Data Frame Object — tif_is_tokens_df
title: Validate Tokens Data Frame Object — tif_is_tokens_df
text: valid tokens data frame object data frame object inherits data frame. row names least two columns. must contain column called doc_id character vector UTF-8 encoding. Document ids must unique. must also contain column called token must also character vector UTF-8 encoding. individual token represented single row data frame. Addition token-level metadata columns allowed required.

title: Validate Tokens Data Frame Object — tif_is_tokens_df
code: tokens <- data.frame(doc_id = c("doc1", "doc1", "doc1", "doc1",                                 "doc2",  "doc2", "doc2", "doc2",                                 "doc2", "doc2", "doc3", "doc3",                                 "doc3", "doc3", "doc3", "doc3"),                      token = c("aujourd'hui", "maman", "est",                                "morte", "it", "was", "a", "pleasure",                                "to", "burn", "all", "this", "happened",                                "more", "or", "less"),                      stringsAsFactors = FALSE)  tif_is_tokens_df(tokens) #> [1] TRUE  tokens$pos <- "NOUN" tokens$NER <- "" tokens$sentiment <- runif(16L) tif_is_tokens_df(tokens) #> [1] TRUE

title: tif 0.3.0
text: discussion lead us simplify corpus token data frame formats. doc_id, text, token columns can position within data frame.

title: tif 0.2.0
text: round input initial version specification, decided allow two formats corpus tokens objects. addition original data frame variants character vector corpus object list-based tokens object. Converts various types now included package.

title: tif 0.2.0
text: tif_is_corpus_character returns TRUE FALSE whether input valid character vector corpus object. tif_is_tokens_list returns TRUE FALSE whether input valid list-based tokens object. tif_as_corpus_character takes valid tif corpus object returns character vector corpus object. tif_as_corpus_df takes valid tif corpus object returns data frame corpus object. tif_as_tokens_character takes valid tif tokens object returns list-based tokens object. tif_as_tokens_df takes valid tif tokens object returns list-based tokens object.

title: tif 0.2.0
text: old validate functions renamed tif_is_corpus_df, tif_is_dtm tif_is_tokens_df. line base-R functions separates “df” version corpus tokens alternative new forms.

title: tif 0.1.0
text: initial implementation ideas discussed rOpenSci Text Workshop 21-22 April 2017.

title: tif 0.1.0
text: tif_corpus_validate returns TRUE FALSE whether input valid corpus object. tif_dtm_validate returns TRUE FALSE whether input valid document corpus object. tif_tokens_validate returns TRUE FALSE whether input valid tokens object.

title: tif 0.1.0
text: yet test suite package encoding checkin yet working
